body_html: I think this might have to do with the NodeDef stored within each node not being updated when AddControlInput is called. If that's the case, then I wonder, why does the executor use that serialized version of the node, even when it may be outdated?
body_text: I think this might have to do with the NodeDef stored within each node not being updated when AddControlInput is called. If that's the case, then I wonder, why does the executor use that serialized version of the node, even when it may be outdated?
body: I think this might have to do with the `NodeDef` stored within each node not being updated when `AddControlInput` is called. If that's the case, then I wonder, why does the executor use that serialized version of the node, even when it may be outdated?
